Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2008 10:28PM kes wrote: Dibel, Can you call the PS before it gets to large to break the incision open and have her drain it manually with a needle and syringe? Would she do that or what has she advised you to do about the seroma? I used to have to go back to the PS's clinic and have it drained weekly. I hope that you get some relief soon. These things are a pain and can be persistant. Good Luck, Kerry
Posts.Title: Seroma again---Sigh dibel dibel

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2008 09:03AM kes wrote: Dibel, I had bilat mast done on Jan25/08 with tissue expanders at the same time. I had 2 drains and my right one came out early. The PS took it out when it was draining 50cc/24 hours. I developed a seroma on my right side. The PS drained it 3 times with a needle and then she would do an expansion at the same time to try and get the space filled with expander so it would not reappear. When I was done with the fills I still had the seroma and she decided not to drain it anymore and to just leave it .She told me that if it got really big to give her a call. It stayed the same and then I waited from Feb 11-June 6/08 for my exchange surgery and everything went well. I did not have rads so I don't know what effect that will have on the seroma. Hope that helps some, Kerry

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 08:12PM kes wrote:  I saw my G.P. today and that is what I told him, " I am not depressed, but I am sad, and some days it is like a bottomless pit of sadness". He told me that it is post tramautic stress disorder and that after BM and tissue expanders and implant exchange that now my brain is trying to catch up to my body and process it all. He suggested a medication and I will think about it. My life has changed forever and will never be the same. If one more person told me that "you look great" during all of this, I thought that I was goint to SCREAM " I don't feel great." What a long process!!! I think that things get better slowly and that it takes time. Kes.

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 01:41PM kes wrote: Hi Kathy, Things are moving quickly for you. A lot of info all at once to consider. I thought of a few good threads that are around and they might help you also. One was "unilateral versus bilateral" and another one was "mastectomy for DCIS" and they are on this web site. Also check out www.breastreconstruction.org web site, it is very good. I also borrowed a book from a Nurse Practioner and it has a web address also which is www.reconstructingaphrodite.com, I found this very helpful to make my decision. I think that you can order it online. Good Luck with your new consults. I was diagnosed Oct 18/07 from an excisional biopsy and I had my bilat mast on Jan 25/08 due to Christmas and NewYears and the scheduling of both the BS and PS in the OR on the same day.Tissue expanders can be painful and some women feel the pain more than others and then some women only describe a mild discomfort. I do not know why the difference is, there is no reason for it that I could ever figure out. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 12:54PM - edited Apr 30, 2008 01:31PM by kes Hi Ladies, Kathy,  Thanks for the hug for my little one. She is only eight, but a very old soul. I had an excisional biopsy done last fall when my Mom was in california and I told her that I did not want to tell Grandma about it just yet. She came over to me and rubbed my back and said "That's O.K. Mom, we will tell Grandma when you are ready" What a kid, WOW!! Then when I had to go for bilat mast with tissue expanders I was trying to tell her how I would look after, because she is always in the bathroom with me, and sees me coming out of the shower all the time. Her response to me was " that tissue in your boobs is rotten and you have to get it removed before it makes your whole body rotten" Then I told her that I would be flat chested just like a boy and she told me "that is O.K. You will look just like me". I cannot believe her sometimes, she is just so right on. Flyrzfan,  Sorry to hear that you need more surgery.Sending warm healing thoughts your way.I hope your arm continues to improve. Sheila,  I hope that your flap does O.K. also. Warm healing thoughts for you too. Take care ladies, Kerry
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 12:02AM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, Tina337,  I had bilat mast with tissue expanders done on Jan 25/08. My restrictions were no heavy lifting for 6 weeks, greater than 5 lbs, no grocery shopping,laundry baskets, or vacuuming. I was filled pretty fast as my PS is fairly aggressive in her thinking. It hurt like h**l but at 2 weeks and 3 days I was up to 360cc of expansion and I had to return to have 25cc drawn off due to pain. She told me that I could do some light stretching exercises and to see a Physiotherapist, which I did and it helped. I find that all PS's are so different in their thinking. My chest did loosen up with time.Check with your PS to see if he recommends stretching at this time. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 07:47AM - edited Apr 23, 2008 01:25PM by kes Kathy, Thanks for your well wishes. Let us know what you decide to do. I also had DCIS in the right breast (which was the "good" one) and was being followed since 1999 with yearly mammograms. Was recommended to have mast on the right side and also told to think about mast on the left. After a lot of research and thinking and talking to my husband I decided to have bilat mast done with tissue expanders and implants. I also considered DIEP, but thought at the time that I would try expanders first and if that did not work then could always have DIEP done later. PS said that this was possible, if expanders had any complications. It was a tough decision, but I knew that if I was going to have one mast, that I would not want to do it again in a few years and I also wanted the symettry (sp?) of both breasts. I do miss my nipples though as they were very sensitive. After the final path report came back there was area in the left breast that was atypical lobular hyperplasia, so in the end I was soooooooooo relieved that I had done the bilat mast. You will do what is right for you. It is a journey just to make this decsion and the type of reconstruction that you want. Talk to the PS in detail. My PS drew pictures for me and explained everything to me. Hope that Helps. Kerry
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 07:20AM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, Stacey, Jill, and Jackie,  Glad to hear that your surgeries went well. I see that 2 of you are from Canada. I am in Ontario in the southwest,close to Lake Erie. Kathy,  It was difficult to wait the 3 months for the surgery. I had my diagnosis by the end of Oct and then had to see the PS which was Nov 20, so there was some lag time to think about things.Then when I had decided to have immediate reconstruction with the BS and PS it was Christmas and New Years time and a hospital slow down time where they only do Emergence case O.R.'s. Once Christmas was over for me I just wanted to get the surgery done but had to wait until Jan25/08. I did not have too much trouble sleeping after the surgery. I could lie in my bed with 2 pillows and if I curled in my shoulders it seemed to help. I also had a sleeping pill that I took. It was Zoplicone and I used it a few times. I was expanded fairly fast and I think that is why I had a lot of my pain. My PS can be fairly aggressive with her thinking. I also had a seroma (fluid pocket) on the right side after she took my drain out early. I had to have the seroma drained 3 times and then after that she wanted to do a fill to fill in the pocket with the expander and not give the seroma any more space to develop. In the end she stopped draining the seroma and it stopped forming and the expander on the right fell down into the space. I have had them in now since Jan 25th and they are livable. I take tylenol ES and Flexeril 5mg during the day. I could go back to work and I may have to now before the exchange surgery. I was actually up to 360cc of expansion on each side at about 2 weeks and 3 days post op which is incredibly fast, but I did not know that at the time , until I started reading the thread "continued tissue expander pain". Also my PS was telling me that the pain from a fill should go away in 48hrs (NOT!!!).The other thread was good to show me that my pain was not unnormal. Once the fills are done they do loosen up and drop. Your skin and muscle loosen up. There are a lot of different hints on the other thread about tissue expanders. Some of them worked for me and others did not. A lot of women slept in a recliner chair. You will find what works best for you as you go along. Also the PS can take out some saline if the expander is too painful. I had 25cc taken off at my last fill which brought me down to 335cc of expansion. Hope that helps. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Title: mastectomy photos shrink buchanwebb1

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 01:41PM - edited Apr 10, 2008 12:21AM by kes Hi Trumum, I also had DCIS in the right breast and it was multifocal, could not get clear margins on an excisional biopsy of the right side. This was the "good" side. It was found on my yearly mammogram which was to watch the left side due to atypia. After talking at great length with my Surgeon, his recommendation was a total mastectomy to the right side and to consider doing the left also and to try and not save any nipples, which I asked about. At first I was only going to do the right side and there was NO WAY that I was going to do the left side. After talking to some mastectomy survivors, then I was going to do both sides and try to save one nipple. After talking to the Plastic Surgeon, who said that the one remaining nipple would probably not have much sensation to it, and after talking to my Breast Surgeon again and asking him what his bottom line recommendation to me would be, which was bilat mast and both nipples should be removed, was I able to come to the same decision as the Surgeon. It was a stressful time and a VERY hard decision to make. I was even holding on to some faint hope right up to the day before surgery that maybe I could keep one breast or just one nipple, but I knew what I needed to do for myself to stay healthy. I had a mother in law (loved her dearly) who had a 30 year history with this dreaded disease and I saw the last 20 years of her fighting this THING and I made my mind up then that if this ever happened to me that I would go for a bilat mast and have implant reconstruction. That is what I did. I didn't want to but I knew that I had to. Definetly the toughest decision I have ever had to make in my life. You will do what is right for you and your family. Best of luck. P.S. My tissue expanders are in place and I have my exchange surgery on Apr.25/08 Also my final pathology report on the left side came back showing an area of Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia. I was sooooo glad that I did both sides.Also now I know that I did not want to go through this surgery again, and from the path report it looks like I would of had to of, down the road. Kerry

What a tough decision. Kerry

Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 12:57AM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, Dani, You make me laugh, I just love your attitude!!!!! I cannot type worth crap after a few glasses of wine,also. Staymom, On my final path report there were areas of DCIS on the right side that could not be felt and also could not be seen on the mammogram. I had mammogram, then mammogram with magnification views, then an ultrasound, then a needle biopsy (which came back clear, but an excisional biopsy was recommended) and then an excisional biopsy, which picked up the multifocal DCIS. This happened in summer/fall of 2007. DCIS can be very tricky. So my advice would be that if the Doctors are chasing you around (and I don't mean around his office) to do more testing, then it is a good idea to follow up on this. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2009 03:22PM kes wrote: Mainer, That is just awful treatment. Totally unethical of them to do that to you.Crappy for sure.  I just love Maine. We vacation on Bailey Island every summer. I just love it there. Peaceful place. Renee, I found that they do not tell you a thing if they know that you are a nurse. "She's a nurse, she knows it all"  You miss the simple basic post op teaching. I think that I scared my homecare nurse post bilat mast and TE. I basically did the dressing changes, and she didn't even have any supplies in her car truck. I had to go to my car and get supplies out of my trunk. I also do homecare visits. And this was my second day post op. Please don't come to do a dressing if you don't have any supplies. DDUUUUUHHHHHHH!!!!!!! Kerry

I went back to work with the expanders in for 4 weeks before the exchange and I drive all day for work and it was O.K. Kerry

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 12:35AM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, Trumum and Anne, I do miss my breasts and expecially my nipples. I was a full B and very comfortable with this. With the expanders I am now a full C and waiting for the exchange surgery which is Apr 25/08. PS said that she could return me to a full B or a small C which I will be very happy with. I do not want to be large. The waiting is the hardest part because you just want some form of breasts back, and to be able to buy nice bras again. Sometimes I just look in the mirror and I think "What the h*ll happened to you". I am definetly going through the mourning period now. But I know that my breasts were not worth the cost of my life. But it is a hard pill to swallow. The loss of nipple sensation is what gets to me. Anne,   Your story and mine are very similar. I will let you know how my exchange surgery goes. I am usually on "continues tissue expander pain" or "anyone having surgery in April" threads. Take Care, P.S. When the surgery is over and things settle I am going out and buying all of the fancy bras that I can find and in every colour too.Look Out, there will be no stopping me!!!!!!!!!!LOL!!!!!!!!!! Kerry Kerry
Posts.Title: MASTECTOMY FOR DCIS thetrumumshow Noni

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 05:58AM - edited Apr 12, 2008 06:00AM by kes Hi Ladies, Trumum, So sorry to hear about your mother. This is a very emotional time just with having to have a possible mastectomy. The news is very shocking for sure. I remember driving home one day after work and a lot of stuff was going on for me and then I had to cope with my diagnosis and I just remember the OVERWHELMING feeling of not wanting to go home at all and just wanting to go and be someone else and take over their life. It was just the weirdest feeling that I ever had. Talk with your family and tell them how your feel. This is a very difficult time in your life and having to deal with the grief of your MUM, and now this diagnosis. I remember feeling the same way also, I just wanted to wake up and have it all go away, it was like a bad dream. It is tough. Hang in there. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 12:22AM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, I already had my exchange surgery on June 6/08. Day surgery, only in the O.R. 1 hour and 15 minutes, no drains, and chest is soft. I am wearing a big piece of foam above the implants to keep them from floating up. Only taking 1 tylenol#3 in am and afternoon and 1 tylenol ES at bedtime. Feel good physically. I have a cleavage. This is a big deal. I have never had one before. They look like a B cup and that is all I wanted. The final unveiling is at the PS's office on Tuesday. I can hardley wait. Will let you know how things go. For anyone waiting for the exchange surgery it will feel soooo much better. Take Care, Kerry

Posts.Title: Panic Attack!! Too Soon crazydaisy crazydaisy

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2009 09:43PM kes wrote: Hi Ladies, Another nurse here. Had bilat mast and implant reconstruction in Jan 2008. Am getting close to the end of reconstruction. One more procedure to go in Jan. and hopefully I will be done then. All the times that I was in the hospital having tests and surgeries done I did not tell anyone that I was a nurse. I would tell my DH not to tell them that I was a nurse. All the other nurses will not talk around you nor will the Doctors. I found out that my DCIS was pretty extensive when the Radiologist was looking at the computer screen when I was in the mammogram machine and she was talking to the tech in the room. You can usually find out a lot by all the chatter around you in the hospital. Nurses are really careful around othere Nurses who are patients. Kerry
Posts.Title: Nurses with Breast Cancer Jo_Ann_K PatRN10
